Black holes were first predicted to exist in 1916 by albert einstein’s general theory of relativity. Fiction depicts black holes as yawning voids that lurk in deep space, gobbling up anything in their path, but how does science explain these 'dark stars'? The nobel prize in physics this year honors pioneering studies about the nature of black holes, including the discovery of the gigantic one lurking in the heart of our milky way.
